quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Can you confirm that the straps are tight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes. But this [pulls at straight jacket] seems to be...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And now, the chains.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: A lot of people think that magic camp is just for kids. And that's why so many other people in my class were kids. Self fulfilling prophecy. It's um, it's really for anybody with a dream and a belief in magic and a little extra time after school.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: MAGIC MAGIC Magic Magic magic magic... And now, Michael the Magic, will attempt to escape from extreme bondage. [Kevin giggles] Can he do it? I don't see how he can.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know how. Dislocate his shoulder and slip his arm out from underneath.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. No. Everyone, now count down with me. THREE!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sorry, quick thing. Is it true that if you can't get out, you don't want anyone to help you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I will get out. Oh yes, I will.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So we shouldn't help you, no matter how much you might beg and plead?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. Alright, this is getting hot. So let's just do this. Ok, ready? Three, two, one, go. [Michael spits out key, Jim covers it with his foot.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: AHHHH!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Is everything ok, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I cannot tell you how I plan to escape. Other than by using magic. That is the magician's code. Separately, on an unrelated note, if you happen to find a small brass key...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [trumpet sounds]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ready? Come on guys. Early worm gets the worm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Another worm? Like, are they friends?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's early bird gets the worm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pam, would you smell my breath?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Let me smell. [Michael breathes at Dwight] Good, not great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: "Michael, you go to parties all the time, why is tonight so special?" Well, tonight is so special because my boss's boss's boss, the CFO, not his initials, common mistake, is having a little shindig for all the managers in the company. And Jan and I are going as a couple. For the first time. So it's kind of our coming out party. Really. And that is why tonight is so special.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jimbo, last chance to carpool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh no thanks, I think Karen and I will take my car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sure? Might be a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Go in together, could save some gas, have some fun, long trip.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Play some games?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh. Um. I think we're good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I spy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Why don't I wanna go? Didn't expect to need a reason, so let me think here. Um. I don't know any of these people. It's an obligation. I don't like talking paper in my free time, or in my work time. And, did I use the word pointless?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thanks for inviting me along.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, sure. Really didn't give it any thought. Wait, should you be going? [phone rings] Heh-woh you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, Buttercup.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am on my way. I should be there in about 15...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Let's just blow this party off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Am I on speaker phone?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh, yes you are.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Is anybody else in the...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hello, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Hi, Dwight. Ok, Michael, take me off speaker phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No problem. [doesn't turn off speakerphone]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Ok. Let's just go to a motel...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: ...and just like rip into each other like we did on that black sand beach in Jamaica.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok. Jan. Jan? This party is actually a really big step for us. So, I...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Still on speaker?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ummm... I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Are camera's there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: See you soon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Talk to you later, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, Michael left early, so a bunch of us are going to go to Poor Richard's for happy hour. You should come.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: I can't. My brother, he just unloaded the jet ski's and kinda took a bath, so... we're going to go get hammered.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ok, well, we're going to a bar. Hey. You have to come to stuff with me. I'm serious! If you're going to be my boyfriend, you have to do boyfriend things.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I have decided that I'm going to be more honest. I'm going to tell people what I want. Directly. So, look out world, cause ol' Pammy is getting what she wants. And, don't call me Pammy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Beauty. Thank you sir!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Salad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You dressed exactly like the servants.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Shut up. Ok, change shirts with me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait. I don't think yours will fit me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't care. Oh, wow. Here. Don't put my jacket. Don't give me that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That would have been really embarrassing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Crisis averted.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, that duck is so cute.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hey Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oscar. Angela.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Actually, it's polite to arrive early. And smart. Only really good friends show up early. Ergo de facto. Go to a party really early. Become a really good friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, um, potato salad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's from both of us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, it's not.

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: Wonderful, let's, ah, see where we can put this. Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, you probably want to leave the cover on until the guests get here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's been sitting in my car all day. Sun beating down on the mayonnaise. Just, you never know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Kevin, you and Stacy set a date yet?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh my God, when is it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: It's complicated. I would appreciate some space on this.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey. You made it.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: You said it was important, so... How's it going?

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.line: What's up, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey Kenny, sorry about the jet skis.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: You guys, uh, want a round, on me?

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Yeah? Get you a drink.

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.line: Thanks man.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No thank you, Roy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, you know that line on the top of the shrimp? That's feces.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What are you looking for? You bring dip?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I'm sure that it's catered. I need you to sign these, Michael. It's a waver of some of your rights. You should read it carefully. It releases the company in the event that our relationship, in your opinion or in reality, interferes with work. You get a copy, I get a copy, and a third copy goes to HR.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Awesome. I'm going to frame mine. I could frame yours too.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: You realize this is a legal document that says you can't sue the company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Over our love.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I've never told you that I love you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You don't have to, Jan. This contract says it all.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I am taking a calculated risk. What's the upside? I overcome my nausea, fall deeply in love, babies, normalcy, no more self loathing. Downside? I, uh, date Michael Scott publicly and collapse in on myself like a dying star.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: What's this over the "i"?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's a heart.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Why is this so hard? That's what she said. Oh my God. What am I saying?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I love this woman!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Oh, no. Michael, please. Michael, please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do you ever watch Battlestar Galactica?

quotes.speaker: Dan Gore
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No? Then you are an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: Hello Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Rachel. Boy, you clean up good. Place looks great with all the lights on. And everything.  Actually looks bigger with people in it. It's weird. So...

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Jan, glad you could make it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Of course, of course, David. Do you remember Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Of course I do.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: From the Scranton Branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jan and I are lovers. It feels so good to finally say that out loud.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: David, can I, um, speak to you privately for just a moment, please.

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [looks at beers] Oh. [Starts to walk away, turns around] No. Actually, one of these is supposed to be a lite.

quotes.speaker: Bartender
quotes.line: Oh, sorry.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: So did the merger go smoothly, or?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It did. Like butter. Mike Myers, SNL. You should ask Karen, she was one of them.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: I'm the only one left. Everyone else was either fired or quit. And there is one in Anger Management.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, but you're great now, right? We're all great. Aren't we great?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: We're good. [Michael tries to kiss Jan] Michael, stop. Please stop that, ok?

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: Can I get anyone anything, or?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I could go for an appeteaser.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Martini please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Bagel bites or something.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Rachel, your house is beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What's the square footage?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: About 5,000.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Does that include the garage?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dwight, wow. That's not appropriate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm just...

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: I don't know

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's a common question.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: David, how much did this house cost?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: These old colonials are great, when they're sound. I'd love to take a look around.

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: I'll show you around.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Cool, let's start with the banisters.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Hey, do you see that guy behind you in the blue blazer against the wall?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: That's Drake. And just so you know, I don't want to be weird or anything, but we use to date.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, ok. Cool. Thanks for telling me.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: And it didn't end well.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Gotcha. Alright.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: This was a gift from Lee Iacocca. Twenty year old, single malt scotch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Here is to Mr. Iacocca and his failed experiment, the De Lorean. [takes sip, coughs violently]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: You ok?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. Do you have any ice?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How about some Splenda?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: One, two, three, up Jenkins! Down Jenkins. Oh, I think I heard the quarter over here.

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.line: Where?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: On this side.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No, it is definitely under one of these hands. [points to Meredith and Kelly's hands]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I think I heard it on Roy's side.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No, it is here.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [tapping Meredith and Kelly's hands] Not here. Not here. Not here. Not here.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Good thing you didn't listen to me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah, close one.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: [points at one of Stanley's hands and one of Pam's] Not here. Not here. It's either here or here. [Stares at Pam] Not here. [Points at Stanley's hand].

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.line: YES!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Nice job.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: I can read you like a book.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh yeah?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: You can't keep anything from me.

quotes.speaker: Student 1
quotes.line: Hey Creed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Hey! What are you guys doing here?

quotes.speaker: Student 2
quotes.line: You're the man buddy.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I run a small fake ID company from my car with a laminating machine I swiped from the sheriff's station.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Huh. [Bangs on wall] Yeah, these studs are way too far apart. What's in here? [Opens door].

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: Uh, that's a guest room.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Just the one window?

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: [phone rings] Oh. I must get that. You'll have to excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Are those real pearls?

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: Uh, yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [tests smoke detector] Good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, it was nice meeting you guys. Take care.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Well, if you're wondering why his wife was staring daggers at me, it's because I kinda saw him for a little bit while they were separated.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh. Hadn't noticed.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Really? I thought it was so obvious. I'm glad it didn't make you uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, it was before I knew you so, its fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This one really smells like vanilla. Check that out.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: It's nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You and the misses should join us at Sandals Jamaica next Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I, Michael, I think David probably wants to spend Christmas here with his family.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh yeah, they don't allow kids at Sandals. They are persona non gratis... there. But it's fun. It's an awesome place. You would not believe how low this girl can limbo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Crazy.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I'm sorry. You're just going to have to excuse us for just a couple minutes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok. Excuse me. What's going on? What is it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Sorry. Michael, come here. Just, just, just, just. [kisses Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Don't you know what I'm doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, but you could tell me. What... What is that? Why are you? Why are we going in the bathroom? I thought this is where you liked your privacy.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Shut up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What has gotten into you?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on, let's go back to the party.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Just let me loosen my dress.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Don't take that dress. Stop it, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no, means please don't. Please.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Slam me up against the wall, right here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm not going to slam you up against the wall.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Oh, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're acting inappropriate. Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Oh, I'm acting inappropriate? Get out.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Here. [hands Pam a duck stuffed animal]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, where have you been all night? I was looking forward to hanging out with you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I was...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, don't you have a daughter?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [takes duck back] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh good, you're up. Hey, who makes this chair?

quotes.speaker: Child
quotes.line: I don't know, it was here when I was born.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I want one. It's got good solid construction. Comfortable. What is this? Oak?

quotes.speaker: Child
quotes.line: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What do you know?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: God, I hate these parties. Do you want to sneak out back and shoot some hoops? Meet me outside in two minutes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You stay here and have fun, because I'm going to go out back and shoot hoops with David Wallace.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Ok. Oh, um, don't mention that you and I are dating cause I think he might still have feelings for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wallace? What the hell, have you dated like every guy here? [Karen smiles and gives herself away] Wow. Ok. You got me.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: I so got you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So, none of them?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Of course not. I mean, you're kind of like, my first.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Oh my God, it's so easy. Fun.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Hey Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Not too good.

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: Did you get a chance to try Michael's homemade potato salad?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Rachel thinks that I brought homemade potato salad and I just picked it up at the supermarket. It's funny. I wish I could make potato salad that good. It's just potatoes and mayonnaise. There is something wrong with Jan.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: What's ah, what's with Jan and Michael?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don't know. Where to begin? My ball.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The chimney is in decent shape. Not great. I found some termite damage in a crawl space and some structural flaws in the foundation so all in all, it was a pretty fun cocktail party.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I want us to make it. I want a fresh start.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: That's awesome. That's what I want.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh ok, but in order for us to make it, there can't be any secrets between us.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: I didn't do anything. Ask anyone, I totally could have and I didn't at all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Just listen. Remember that casino night about a month before we were supposed to get married? I kissed Jim.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He told me how he felt and I guess I had feelings too, and we kissed.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Jim came on to you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Just listen.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: No, I am listening! That's the problem I am listening!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Don't yell!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Don't yell?!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: This is over.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Yeah, you're right. This is so over. You kidding me, Pam!? Come on! God!

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.line: Damn jet skis!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Our first fight. If this is about what happened in the bathroom, there was no place to cuddle...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I feel sick.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You didn't have any of the potato salad did you?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: No, we were good when we were just running around, you know, in secret. It was wrong and it was exciting. Maybe it was a mistake to take it public.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, if that's the way you feel, my lady, then you have hurt me greatly.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Please don't cry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm not going to cry. I feel like it but I am not going to. Why don't you just take your stupid love contract and tear it up into a million little pieces.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: It was never a love contract, Michael and besides, I have already given a copy to David and it would be just as embarrassing to get it back as I was handing it to him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I want the house, Jan. I want the picket fence. I want the ketchup fights and the tickling, and the giggling.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I didn't mean it. I was...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whatever.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Tired. I'm tired. And I didn't eat enough. And, and, that's all. That was it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's all, you didn't mean it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: That's all. I didn't mean it. That's all. I'm just saying I didn't mean it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I love you, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don't break up you guys, you're great together.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Are they going to call the cops?

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.line: No, I paid them off.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: Jet ski money?

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.line: All of it.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: I'm gonna kill Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: I think it's great that Jim's invited. It's important to have contact with the New York execs, or they'll think everyone here is like Mi...chael.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: [Points to Pam's painting of the building] [laughs] You gotta sign that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.line: No you gotta put your name in the corner.  I've seen that artist do that.  Its good too, cause like you can know who paints what, you know.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey, are you going to Poor Richard's?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I don't know, you?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I'm going and so are both of you.  We're all going.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey, isn't there some rule against inter-office dating?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [whispering] I am not doing your dirty work for you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I hear whispering.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok, so promise that you'll wait till we leave the parking lot before you go to the bar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes boss.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: See ya Pam.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oscar, Angela?  I didn't think you guys would come.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Why wouldn't we come?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Because of reasons...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Are there carbs in vodka?

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.line: Hey folks, what can I get you?  Oh, hey Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Hey

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.line: Another vodka?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yeah.  Jack, these are my co-workers.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Sup?

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.line: [pointing to each correct person] Ryan, Pam, Stanley, Kelly, Kevin, Creed. How'd I do?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Hmm, come here much?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: These wings are all fat and bone.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: This place is disgusting. [They smile at each other]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Why would the architect design stairs this wide?  Was there an obese family in here before you?

quotes.speaker: Rachel
quotes.line: I don't know that.  I'm sure the architect passed away many years ago.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How convenient.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I am attracted to weird, wrong men.  I dated a violent karate instructor and then an unemployed fireman.  Life has been complicated.  I've made some decisions that I'm not proud of; my marriage, being overly litigious with my family.  I orgasm fairly easily. Michael was kind of like my dirty secret, you know, having sex with him, oh I was just turned on by my own degradation.  Um, why, anyway, I was told by somebody recently that I respect that I'm old enough to have a mature relationship, and that's what this whole evening is about and I have high hopes.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.line: [at the door] Hi Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.line: How are you doing?  I've, I've missed you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I've missed you too...

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.line: Don't you remember me?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Um, you ah, you gotta give me a hint.  Um, did you meet me at the gym?

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [still at the table] Who the hell is Ryan talking to?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [at the door] Are you a client of Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [at the table] Oh, not again.  Melissa!

quotes.speaker: Melissa
quotes.line: Daddy.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Wait for my outside.  [To Ryan] She is sixteen years old.  What is wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Okay, okay.  Stanley, let me explain to you what happened.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: No, no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: She came right up to me just like she did when you brought her into work.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: No, no, no. You planned this whole thing boy.  I'll snatch your spine out your back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Space shuttle. Which one?  Oh, Atlantis.  Good thing it's not the Discovery.  You play soccer?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What a weird day.  I don't understand it, but you don't get to understand everyday of your life.  Maybe five, ten days a year, I'll get home and I will have no idea what the hell just happened.  Guess everybody has days like that.  Sometimes they're the nicest ones.  Still, I think there might be something wrong with Jan.
